Sign in Report this job Direct message the job poster from MagicBlock Labs Andrea Fortugno Andrea Fortugno Co-Founder and CEO at Magicblock About us MagicBlock Labs is a gaming and technology company building infrastructure for fully onchain games. We are trailblazers, unafraid of challenging the status quo to solve complex problems. We are passionate about gaming as much as we love open-source and building in collaboration with our community. Backed by Tier 1 investors, our team is a mix of technical and creative talent on a quest to define a new vision for open, permissionless and unstoppable games. Role Overview We're looking for a talented Game Developer, proficient in Unity/Phaser/Babylonjs or similar game engines, to work on a series of upcoming titles built on our custom infrastructure. You will play a key role in our gaming team, working closely with our infrastructure team to push the boundaries of onchain games with novel, category-defining titles. Key Responsibilities Develop cutting-edge games using Unity and/or other game engines Innovative Design: collaborate closely with the rest of the team to design innovative game mechanics and integrate our technology, while ensuring a seamless user experience. Maintain uncompromised quality standards in the codebase, tools and pipelines, optimising performance and usability Cross-Platform Expertise: oversee the optimization of games for diverse platforms, with a focus on mobile devices. Qualifications Minimum of 3 years of experience in game development Previous work on innovative and interesting games, ideally on mobile. Good understanding of game development best practices and performance optimization across multiple platforms. Strong communication skills, with the ability to clearly articulate complex ideas. English language proficiency Bonus if : You are an expert in C# (Unity) and/or JS/TS (Babylonjs/Phaser) You are knowledgeable and excited about fully onchain games Benefits: Ability to shape a new gaming category, with ample freedom and responsibility Competitive compensation and generous stock options plans (signing bonus & performance-based) Fully remote, flexible working schedule Paid quarterly offsites, conferences and travels. Medical, Dental, Vision insurance (US) New laptop and/or budget for work equipment MagicBlock Labs is an equal opportunity employer. Sign in Report this job Company Description Life at Grab At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the Team GrabRentals (GR) is responsible for securing vehicular supply for the Grab platform. We strive to be a trustworthy partner that creates income opportunities for our driver-partners by sustainably providing them access to quality assets for use in Grab's marketplaces. To better unlock the value of our assets, a comprehensive fleet management system is required for data analysis. Responsibilities Job Description Continue to develop and maintain a full fleet management system on Zoho Creator under the direction of the Fleet Manager Write clean, efficient, and scalable code in Deluge & Java programming language to deliver a system that meets our organizational needs Create technical design documentation, mockups, and application wireframes Work closely with team members, keeping them informed of project developments and escalating complex issues to the IT manager Test, debug, and document software components, ensuring that code meets organizational software quality standards Ensure that project timelines are met and deliverables are produced on time Participate in debugging, bug fixes, and other development and testing-related activities Qualifications Requirements Preferably able to commit full-time from May to August 2024 Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science or related field Solid foundation in Java programming language and database design Experience with Zoho Creator, or comparable low-code platform Knowledge of software development practices and methodologies, with strong attention to detail Ability to write clean, reusable, and efficient code while adhering to best practices Strong communication and teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment A self-starter who can work independently with minimal supervision Additional Information Our Commitment We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique. Sign in Report this job Astek is proposing an opportunity for Mid level Data Engineer to support our Project based in Singapore. Job Description: Responsible for administering, supporting, monitoring, and tuning the Power BI reporting environment; This involves the management and administration of all components of the Power BI domain, including Power BI on-premises data gateway servers. Design and develop PowerBI dashboards and reports. Develop scalable data pipelines using Data connectors, distributed processing transformations, schedulers, and data warehouse. Troubleshoot and debug issues in production environments. Primarily focus on product evaluation, proof of concept (POC), and deployment in an enterprise-wide scope. Design, develop and maintain efficient and accurate ETL pipelines. Requirements Analysis - evaluate and analyse business requirements gathered to gain a clear understanding of the specification and reason for the request. Combine data from multiple sources into efficient Power BI datasets for use by departmental Data Analysts. Evaluate new data visualization products and tools for enterprise use. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure successful project delivery. Provide application support for data-related issues. Requirements: 5-8 years of experience in a Data Engineer role with strong experience in enterprise data visualization tools, specifically PowerBI . Experience in application support, good communication, and programming skills with experience in coding on scripts. Strong experience in Python. Expertise in Data warehousing/ information Management/ Data Integration/Business Intelligence using ETL tool Informatica PowerCenter. Proficient in Tableau Proficient in Informatica. Ability to work independently and in a team environment. Strong project management and organizational skills. Strong communication skill, both written and verbal. Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic environment. Sign in Report this job Direct message the job poster from BoostDraft Yohei Fujii Yohei Fujii Co-founder & CEO & Software Engineer at BoostDraft C# or/and Rust software engineering position in a highly-growing startup, developing a document IDE for non-engineers . About BoostDraft BoostDraft is a software engineering company that develops IDE for documents. It was founded by MIT and Stanford grad students, developing an assisted document editor for documents. It is a new document editor that employs error checking, reference checking and auto-completion using both rule-based approach and NLP, like what coding editors/IDE (e.g. VSCode, Pycharm) do. Demo is in p9, 10, 11, https://link.boostdraft.com/sh1K Background & Traction We are currently focusing on Lawyers who draft relatively standardized but long documents, such as contracts. With only one year after our product launch, we already have more than 7,000 active paid users. We have several long-term, large-scale contracts with famed enterprises and law firms. As a result, we have been highly profitable from Day 1 and experienced exponential growth without outside funding at all. BoostDraft was accepted by prestigious accelerator program, MassChallenge (Top 30 US accelerator), StartX (Stanford Accelerator, 7% acceptance rate), MIT Sandbox (Accelerator of Massachusetts Institute of Technology) Join our Engineering-First Team At BoostDraft, we prioritize quality over quantity. As an engineering-first company. Around 90% of our team members are software engineers with extensive experiences from companies such as Microsoft, IBM, HTC, Yahoo!, and R&D in NTT. Our CEO, Yohei, who has proven experience in both Software Engineering and Business management, and has built an organization that values and empowers software engineers. Why BoostDraft? Join a company that values innovation, research, and organic growth. At BoostDraft, we offer: Extensive Opportunities for extending our software : Similar to VS Code, our software has multiple opportunities in adjacent area, such as Version management, Comparison, Extension, and integration with other software Focus on R&D for new technology: We heavily focus on research for knowledge extraction leveraging user data An Engineering-first approach: The CEO is also a software engineer and over 90% of members are software engineers. We believe in empowering our engineers and providing them with the resources they need to succeed. Rapid organic growth : We have experienced 300% revenue growth, are profitable, and have achieved this without outside investment. All of our revenue is coming from referrals by users, no marketing efforts Technical Challenges We Solve Performance improvement using both partial analysis and full analysis Synchronization between user input and on-memory text Cache efficiency to increase highlight performance t during/after user input Security preserving Natural Language Processing, such as Federated Learning What’s your challenge As a C# Software Engineer at BoostDraft, you will be tackling challenging technical problems, including: Design and implement classes and methods for IDE for documents Refactor existing code for better extensibility Interview with our users to understand their daily work and pain points Propose both innovative ideas and feasible ideas to achieve unprecedented features Who you are Interested in developing novel document editors Fluent in coding with either C#, C++, Java or Rust Believe in beauty of writing clean, efficient code Have experience with Github Understand the concept of CI/CD Master's degree or equivalent experience in Computer Science or related field Fluent in English communication Location Our teams are working fully remotely, and we are expanding our global presence. While our headquarters are currently in Japan, you don't have to relocate to Japan. If you wish to relocate, we are happy to help you obtain a visa. Sign in to save Software Engineer Internship, Frontend/Backend (Starting from May preferably) - Nas.io at Nas Company . Email or phone Password Show Forgot password? Sign in Report this job Direct message the job poster from Nas Company Xiaoqi Chu Xiaoqi Chu Vice President of Engineering at Nas Company | Ex-Shopee Who we are: Founded by Nuseir Yassin from Nas Daily (53 million followers), the Nas company is home to Nas Daily, Nas Academy, Nas Studios – and Nas.io. “Nas” means “people” and it has been the foundation of our mission: Bring People Together. People can do more together. They can find friends, mentors, and accountability partners within a community. The single easiest way to change the world is to create tolerant and passionate communities. And communities today have transformed far beyond the traditional concept of a community. a community can be a group of 100 people who come together every week to share and discuss ideas on Zoom. a community can be 25 people flying in from across the world for a yoga retreat every 3 months. a community can be an influencer’s 1,000 true fans learning from each other in a WhatsApp group. a community can be 10,000 NFT holders sharing about events and other projects. As a company, we’ve successfully built communities over and over again – and now, we’ve raised a total of US$23 million to build powerful tools and integrations that will allow other people to build communities faster than ever before. Nas.io is a product for people to have a trustworthy and internationally recognized place to start and manage their communities – including brands, thought leaders, coaches, entrepreneurs, content creators, and DAO builders. With Nas.io, you can have a beautiful home for your community, integrate with the chat platforms your members use, own your community with magic reach, engage your community with rich content, and generate revenue with your community. It’s everything you need, and more! Explore more on https://nas.io/ Why work with us: We have set up a strong engineering team with senior members from leading IT companies. You have a growth mindset and thrive in a fast-paced and fun environment. You have the same conviction as us and you want to work hard and grow together with like-minded people. You enjoy working in a diverse and vibrant working environment with people of different cultures. We are a diverse bunch of over 18 different nationalities, spread around the world from Singapore, UAE, India, Pakistan, Israel, South Africa, the Philippines, etc. We won’t let anyone feel alone. We have company-level retreats yearly to gather together. There’s a high chance your current job isn’t exciting for you and that’s why you are looking for something new. We are more than just another usual IT company you might know of. Our ventures extend to the foundation of media, creator education, and community. And we are far from corporate. You love the concept of building communities and are excited about the prospect of building products that will bring people together. You feel very accomplished by creating a larger impact. We give you autonomy to own certain scope and deliver projects/features from end to end. You enjoy working in a transparent environment where you can have your opinions and push the boundaries. We offer a competitive salary with a substantial share package. If the company is doing well financially, so will you. What we are looking for: 📅 Relevant Technical Experience: Experience with React, Next.js, Node.js, AWS, and MongoDB will be considered a plus, as it aligns with our technology stack and enhances your ability to contribute effectively. 🔍 Good Knowledge and Learning Ability: Demonstrate a strong and deep understanding of best practices in modern web application development and eager to know why. 🚀 Enthusiastic About Solving Engineering Problems: Stay proactive in exploring new technologies, tools, and methodologies to enhance work quality and improve efficiency. 🤝 Collaboration: We value individuals who foster a collaborative environment and actively support their peers in becoming better versions of themselves. Encouraging knowledge sharing, providing guidance, and promoting teamwork are qualities we highly appreciate. 🗣️ Effective Communication and Team Player: Excellent English skills are essential for clear and efficient communication within our global team. We also seek individuals with a high energy level and a great team player attitude, who can contribute positively to our dynamic and collaborative work environment. Tech stack we are mainly using: Frontend: React/Next.js/Vercel/AdminJS/Flutter Backendr: NodeJS/Python/AWS/MongoDB/Grafana Stack Dev Tools: Cypress/Apifox/Testim/Jira/Confluence/Lark But don’t be limited to them. We are open to change if you have better solutions! Benefits: At Nas Company, we work hard, REALLY HARD! So we value our employees' well-being and believe that a supportive and fulfilling work environment contributes to their success. We're proud to offer a range of benefits that will enhance your professional and personal life. Here's what you can look forward to as part of our team: 💻 Remote Working: For those based in our offices, we provide the flexibility of remote work. Enjoy a balance between the office and your preferred workspace. 🍎 Fully Stocked Fridges: Stay fueled and energized with our fully stocked fridges featuring a selection of healthy, high-protein, and low-calorie snacks and drinks. 👯‍♀️ Team Outings: We believe in the power of connection. Join us for team outings that foster strong relationships and create lasting memories. 🏖️ Yearly Retreats: Unwind, bond, and collaborate at our annual company retreats. A time for the entire company to come together to rejuvenate and bond. 🌍 Nas Summit and Nas Travels: Employees who successfully clear probation are eligible for a choice between attending 1 Nas Summit or 1 Nas Travels trip per year, fully sponsored (T&Cs) 🚕 Transport Allowance: Employees located in Singapore and Dubai enjoy a transport allowance, making your daily commute more convenient. At Nas Company, we're committed to nurturing a supportive and engaging workplace that promotes your growth and well-being. Join us and enjoy a comprehensive array of benefits designed with you in mind Believe in our mission? Join us in building the platform for creators, by creators. Job_txt: Software Engineer Intern, API and Backend Datature Singapore, Singapore 2 weeks ago Over 200 applicants See who Datature has hired for this role Apply Save Save job Save this job with your existing LinkedIn profile, or create a new one. .  Sign in to save Software Engineer Intern, API and Backend at Datature . Email or phone Password Show Forgot password? Sign in Report this job 👉 Full-Time Internship - Minimum 3-6 Months - Summer '24 Cohort - Read the Post At Datature, we are building a platform for training and deploying machine learning models swiftly without a single line of code. Datature Nexus is an MLOps platform that allows users to label unstructured data and construct complex machine learning pipelines all in their browsers using highly visual editors. Datature's users have leveraged our platform to solve problems in a myriad of verticals - from grading crops to optimizing manufacturing to MLB Teams, to identifying diseases from MRI scans. Datature levels the playing field for teams and companies in antiquated industries to start AI-driven revolutions of their own. The Scope 🔭 Datature’s platform features a drag-and-drop visual editor that translates to thousands of lines of TensorFlow codes in the backend. This requires a handful of services to work together seamlessly. You will learn how large machine learning data are handled in the backend artfully - to empower machine learning systems to operate smoothly. You will be coding, testing, and deploying to our main production service. About You 🤖 Experience using TypeScript , ExpressJS, and Python Strong understanding of containerization and orchestration technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes Interest in machine learning systems and big data ingestion strategies Exposure to working with both relational and NoSQL databases , with a focus on MongoDB or PostgreSQL Knowledge of test-driven development and experience implementing it in previous projects Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform or AWS, and the ability to work with cloud-based infrastructure Some familiarity with server-side caching techniques and tools, such as Redis or Memcached with the comfortability to talk about cache-invalidation strategies for hours Some experience with message brokers like Kafka or RabbitMQ, and building distributed systems Linear Algebra Minimum Requirements You don’t need a Computer Science degree to write great software. We are looking for hackers and enthusiasts who have participated in hackathons / competitive programming / open-source development. Your coding projects outside of school curriculums matter more than your grades - we'd love to discuss your most passionate projects rather than a list of curriculum-mandated projects. Who We Are Looking For 📍 You are a reliability-minded engineer passionate about uptime and data integrity. You have experience scaling both teams and projects in similar spaces. Above all, you are passionate about data, machine learning, and user experience. You understand the tradeoffs with each line of code and have an idea of what the various priorities are with each project. Why You'll Love Us 🎈 We are a technology-first team dedicated to developing the most intuitive and performant platform to shape the way users think about building machine learning capabilities. We are a quirky group of engineers whom you will enjoy debating about codes and algorithms with. Gone are the days when you have to build yet another internal monitoring tool for a team that doesn't appreciate the performance. You will be solving the most important problems at the intersection of machine learning, data processing, and distributed systems. You will have the largest impact on how our users interact with the Datature platform via API and the experience they have whilst doing so - and you care about the P95 Perf. If this is your cup of tea, we have been waiting to hear from you. Sign in Report this job Blackstone is the world’s largest alternative asset manager. We seek to create positive economic impact and long-term value for our investors, the companies we invest in, and the communities in which we work. We do this by using extraordinary people and flexible capital to help companies solve problems. Our $1 trillion in assets under management include investment vehicles focused on private equity, real estate, public debt and equity, infrastructure, life sciences, growth equity, opportunistic, non-investment grade credit, real assets and secondary funds, all on a global basis. Further information is available at www.blackstone.com. Follow @blackstone on LinkedIn, Twitter, and Instagram. Innovations Profile: Blackstone Technology and Innovations (BXTI) is the technology team at the core of each of Blackstone’s businesses and new growth initiatives. Serving both internal and external clients, we work to build the next generation of systems that manage risk, create efficiency and improve transparency within the firm and across our broad community of investors and portfolio companies. BXTI is nimble and entrepreneurial – our open, iterative design processes and rapid pace of development mean that everyone on the team has the opportunity to make an impact from day one. We are problem solvers who can take projects from idea to implementation. We believe in active mentoring and developing excellence. We collaborate to find the best answers for our customers and for Blackstone. We are critical to the firm maintaining its competitive edge. Your Role: The BXTI Alternative Asset Management Technology team is looking for a 6-month Engineering intern to join in 2024, who can commit to full-time employment from July to December 2024. As a full stack software engineer, you’ll develop innovative technologies that are changing the Alternative Asset Management industry. You’ll work with other engineers and business analysts across Singapore and New York to design, build, deploy, and support Blackstone Innovations' suite of applications. Our custom-built applications are mostly developed in Python or C# on the .NET platform with JavaScript/React/Node.js and hosted within AWS. We take full advantage of cloud native container-based and serverless architectures. We also build robust data pipelines connecting to Snowflake for data analysis and visualization. You’ll devise elegant solutions to Blackstone's most meaningful technical challenges and put your own best ideas to work in an entrepreneurial environment inside one of the leading companies in its industry. How you'll make an impact and the tools you'll use to do it: Build web applications, services, and functionality on a variety of platforms Develop on top of AWS in order to build cloud native, serverless first solutions Utilize Docker to create containerized microservices Automate infrastructure configuration using Terraform Use tools such as Airflow, dbt and AWS Step Functions to build data pipelines Integrate various JavaScript libraries such as React to deliver seamless user experiences Design data models and transform data with dbt Optimize and persist data in Snowflake Use TeamCity and Jenkins to automate deployments Write automated unit, integration, and deployment tests Build tooling to automate away repetitive tasks The skills and experience you'll need to make an impact: Object-oriented programming experience in C# or Python SQL experience to work with data in Snowflake Strong analytical, problem solving, critical thinking and decision-making skills, with the ability to multitask and deliver under tight deadlines; the candidate should be a self-starter that thrives on complexity and solution finding A desire to learn and adapt to new technologies A self-starting, entrepreneurial attitude A desire to keep improving Strong interpersonal and communication skills Eligibility: To be considered for the 2024 Software Engineer Program, applicants must meet the following criteria: Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student or graduate student in Computer Science and /or Engineering majors are preferred, while other majors may be considered Undergraduate, Master (non-MBA) who will be graduate in between December 2024 to June 2025 Commit to working full time for the entire duration of the internship Resume must include expected graduation month and year and GPA Resume must be in PDF format Program Commencement July to December 2024 (6-month, start and end-date can be flexible) The duties and responsibilities described here are not exhaustive and additional assignments, duties, or responsibilities may be required of this position. Assignments, duties, and responsibilities may be changed at any time, with or without notice, by Blackstone in its sole discretion. Blackstone is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, sex, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, marital or partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, genetic predisposition, veteran or military status, status as a victim of domestic violence, a sex offense or stalking, or any other class or status in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to hiring, placement, promotion, termination, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training. All Blackstone employees, including but not limited to recruiting personnel and hiring managers, are required to abide by this policy. If you need a reasonable accommodation to complete your application, please contact Human Resources at 212-583-5000 (US), +44 (0)20 7451 4000 (EMEA) or +852 3656 8600 (APAC). Depending on the position, you may be required to obtain certain securities licenses if you are in a client facing role and/or if you are engaged in the following: Attending client meetings where you are discussing Blackstone products and/or and client questions; Marketing Blackstone funds to new or existing clients; Supervising or training securities licensed employees; Structuring or creating Blackstone funds/products; and Advising on marketing plans prepared by a sales team or developing and/or contributing information for marketing materials. Note: The above list is not the exhaustive list of activities requiring securities licenses and there may be roles that require review on a case-by-case basis. Please speak with your Blackstone Recruiting contact with any questions. To submit your application please complete the form below. Fields marked with a red asterisk * must be completed to be considered for employment (although some can be answered "prefer not to say"). Failure to provide this information may compromise the follow-up of your application. When you have finished click Submit at the bottom of this form. Sign in Report this job Job Description As a team member of Research and Advanced Engineering team, you will be involved in the software development of innovative system solutions, for example the integration of innovative sensing technologies with specific focus on future solutions for both the Autonomous and Passenger vehicles or robots. Intern would be working together with the innovation team in the following tasks: Develop software applications and necessary APIs. Rapid prototype developments. Located in Singapore, our team collaborates with partners in Bangkok and London, embodying innovation, diversity, and technological expertise. Our vision is to employ technology to create a financial ecosystem that is efficient, ethical, and sustainable. The Opportunity As a Software Engineering Intern within the Sustainable Finance & Innovation Team,, you will have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects at the intersection of technology and sustainable finance. This role offers exposure to a diverse tech stack and the chance to apply your skills in a real-world setting. What You'll Do Work with a Leading-Edge Tech Stack: Gain exposure to technologies including Python or JavaScript, Terraform, AWS, and serverless architectures like DynamoDB, API Gateway, and Lambda functions. Lead a Capstone Project: Oversee a capstone project from start to finish, with guidance from senior team members, applying your technical skills to a tangible project within the realm of sustainable finance. Deep Dive into Sustainable Finance: Acquire deep insights into sustainable finance, positioning yourself at the forefront of this transformative industry. Experience Multicultural Collaboration: Be part of a vibrant, multicultural team, benefiting from the diversity of thoughts and innovations. Receive Mentorship: Enjoy mentorship from industry leaders eager to share their knowledge and contribute to your professional growth. Who We're Looking For Enrolled in a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field, with a strong interest in applying technology to societal challenges. Curious about the potential of technology to drive positive change and keen to explore new solutions. Possesses strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to develop creative and effective solutions to complex challenges. An effective communicator, capable of working well within a diverse team environment. Adaptable and open to learning, ready to engage in a vibrant and evolving setting. Required Skills And Experience Programming Languages: Proficiency in Python or JavaScript. Familiarity with both is a plus. Web Development: Experience with React, or a strong interest in learning it. API Development: An understanding of RESTful APIs, with experience in API Gateway and Lambda functions considered a plus. Serverless and Cloud Technologies: Familiarity with AWS and an understanding of serverless architecture is considered a plus. Microservices Architecture: An understanding of microservices architecture principles, beneficial for designing and developing scalable and maintainable applications. Software Development Practices: A foundation in software development principles, including version control (e.g., Git), and CI/CD pipelines. Experience with containerization tools like Docker is a plus. Database Technologies: Knowledge of or willingness to learn database technologies, especially DynamoDB, or experience with other NoSQL databases. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively. What's In It For You A Pathway to Your Future: This internship is a gateway to the dynamic world of sustainable finance, equipping you with essential skills and knowledge for a thriving career in technology. A Diverse and Inclusive Experience: Join a team where diversity and inclusion are celebrated, and your unique perspectives are valued. Personalized Mentorship: Receive direct mentorship from experienced professionals dedicated to your learning and professional development. We are committed to fostering an inclusive and diverse workplace and encourage applications from all technical backgrounds. Application Deadline: 30 April 2024 Dive into the transformative world of sustainable finance with us. We're eager to see the unique contributions you will bring to our team! LSEG is a leading global financial markets infrastructure and data provider. Our purpose is driving financial stability, empowering economies and enabling customers to create sustainable growth. Our purpose is the foundation on which our culture is built. Our values of Integrity, Partnership , Excellence and Change underpin our purpose and set the standard for everything we do, every day. They go to the heart of who we are and guide our decision making and everyday actions. Working with us means that you will be part of a dynamic organisation of 25,000 people across 65 countries. However, we will value your individuality and enable you to bring your true self to work so you can help enrich our diverse workforce. You will be part of a collaborative and creative culture where we encourage new ideas and are committed to sustainability across our global business. You will experience the critical role we have in helping to re-engineer the financial ecosystem to support and drive sustainable economic growth. Together, we are aiming to achieve this growth by accelerating the just transition to net zero, enabling growth of the green economy and creating inclusive economic opportunity. Sign in Report this job Job Description Life at Grab At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia. Get to know the Team The People Data Warehouse (PDW) team provides the data foundations used for real-world problem solving in pursuit of a high performing people culture at Grab. The work you do in the PDW team will have an amplifying impact on Grab as it improves thousands of Grabbers who work together to unlock the potential of Grab to drive hundreds of millions to economic empowerment and prosperity. To build this data foundation, we extract and integrate a large variety of data sources and provide a secure, scalable, reliable and efficient platform for processing this data for insights. In spite of being a small team we manage the full life cycle of this data platform which includes requirement gathering and negotiations with data source providers, writing pipelines that ingest the data from source APIs, loading the data into a data warehouse followed by transforming that data. In addition, We also support integrations from various tools that are used by our downstream users who use PDW data for use cases such as business intelligence, analytics and machine learning. Finally, we also manage all of the operations including the infrastructure layer. Currently we maintain our data platform in Azure and as part of a consolidation effort, we are looking to migrate to AWS. Get to know the Role Are you passionate about data and looking for an opportunity to contribute to a high-impact project? We are seeking an Intern to join our team and be a part of an exciting endeavor to migrate a data platform built in Azure to AWS. This internship offers the opportunity to gain in depth practical experience in key data platform technologies in the two most popular cloud environments. The Day-to-Day Activities Write Python/Javascript & SQL code either as components in the ETL framework or as supporting scripts. Collaborate with the project team to understand the existing data warehouse built in Azure Synapse. Assist in designing a migration plan and roadmap for moving the data warehouse to AWS Redshift. Perform data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) activities as part of the migration process. Ensure data integrity and quality throughout the migration process. Work closely with the team to troubleshoot any issues and propose effective solutions. Coordinate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into data migration tasks. Support the team in documenting the migration process, including migration steps, dependencies, and data mappings. Learning Objectives Skills This is an extremely unique opportunity for an aspiring data engineer! Apply now to build your skills across two data & cloud platforms in one shot! As part of the internship you’ll expand your knowledge in following areas: Various components of a modern data platform Data Warehousing with Azure Synapse Data warehousing with AWS Redshift Azure Data Factory & Airflow Data quality Activities required to govern and operate a data platform CI/CD and DevOps practices Azure AWS Implementing Layered and Microkernel architectures. Web applications and APIs Automating periodic activities using scheduled tasks Implementing workflows using web applications The Must-Haves Undergraduate in Software Engineering, Computer Science. We are also happy to hire students from other quantitative fields who are passionate about programming & and have built some cool software applications in the past. Proficiency in Python or Javascript. Familiarity with AWS or Azure Proficiency in SQL. (Go through this tutorial : https://mode.com/sql-tutorial/introduction-to-sql/ if you need to pick this up before interview, once you are familiar with concepts in Advanced Skill tutorial you are good) Some Familiarity with Terraform could be awesome! (if you don’t have this skill, spend a couple of hours to get some basic understanding before the interview) Our Commitment We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.
